Interface EateryRepository

All Superinterfaces:
org.springframework.data.repository.CrudRepository<Eatery,Long>, org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<Eatery,Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListCrudRepository<Eatery,Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.ListPagingAndSortingRepository<Eatery,Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.PagingAndSortingRepository<Eatery,Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.query.QueryByExampleExecutor<Eatery>, org.springframework.data.repository.Repository<Eatery,Long>
@Repository public interface EateryRepository extends org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<Eatery,Long>
Repository interface for performing CRUD and custom query operations on Eatery entities.

This repository enables searching, filtering, and retrieving eatery data based on attributes such as dietary tags, postal code, and free-text search queries. It integrates with the DietaryTags entity for tag-based filtering and supports spatial-related lookups (e.g., duplicate detection).

Spring Data JPA automatically provides default CRUD methods like save(), delete(), findById(), and findAll(), while the custom methods below define domain-specific queries for the “HealthyAura” system.

Since:
2025-11-07
Version:
1.0

  • Method Details

    • findByDietaryTagsIn

      @Query("SELECT DISTINCT e FROM Eatery e JOIN e.dietaryTags dt WHERE dt.tag IN :tags") List<Eatery> findByDietaryTagsIn(@Param("tags") List<String> tags)
      Retrieves all distinct eateries that have at least one dietary tag matching any value in the provided list.

      Used for tag-based filtering when users select multiple dietary preferences such as “Vegan”, “Halal”, or “Low-Sugar”.

      Parameters:
      tags - a list of dietary tag names to match
      Returns:
      a list of distinct Eatery entities with matching tags

    • findByDietaryTag

      @Query("SELECT DISTINCT e FROM Eatery e JOIN e.dietaryTags dt WHERE dt.tag = :tag") List<Eatery> findByDietaryTag(@Param("tag") String tag)
      Retrieves all distinct eateries that match a single dietary tag.

      This method supports searches like “find all Halal eateries”.

      Parameters:
      tag - a dietary tag name to search for
      Returns:
      a list of distinct Eatery entities with the given tag

    • findByPostalCode

      List<Eatery> findByPostalCode(Long postalCode)
      Finds eateries by their registered postal code.

      Useful for geolocation-based filtering or map-centric searches (e.g., “show all eateries in postal code 640123”).

      Parameters:
      postalCode - the postal code of interest
      Returns:
      a list of Eatery entities with the specified postal code

    • findByNameAndLatitudeAndLongitude

      List<Eatery> findByNameAndLatitudeAndLongitude(String name, Double latitude, Double longitude)
      Finds eateries by exact name and coordinates (latitude and longitude).

      This query helps prevent duplicate entries when importing or registering eateries via admin interfaces.

      Parameters:
      name - the eatery’s name
      latitude - the eatery’s latitude coordinate
      longitude - the eatery’s longitude coordinate
      Returns:
      a list of Eatery entities matching the same name and coordinates

    • searchByQuery

      @Query("SELECT e FROM Eatery e WHERE LOWER(e.name) LIKE LOWER(CONCAT('%', :query, '%')) OR LOWER(e.buildingName) LIKE LOWER(CONCAT('%', :query, '%')) OR LOWER(e.address) LIKE LOWER(CONCAT('%', :query, '%')) OR CAST(e.postalCode AS string) LIKE CONCAT('%', :query, '%')") List<Eatery> searchByQuery(@Param("query") String query)
      Performs a flexible keyword search across multiple eatery fields (name, building name, address, and postal code).

      Supports partial and case-insensitive matches for user queries in the front-end search bar.

      Parameters:
      query - a free-text search query
      Returns:
      a list of Eatery entities whose name, building name, address, or postal code contains the given query string
